relevant_findings.general: Chronically ill appearance, alert and oriented to person, place, and time.
relevant_findings.neurological: No abnormal cranial nerve findings, muscle strength 5/5 bilaterally, normal deep tendon reflexes, unsteady gait, limited ambulation due to pain, decreased sensation of pinprick, light touch, and temperature in lower extremities bilaterally.

Needle electromyography revealed very severe axonal sensorimotor polyneuropathy in lower extremities bilaterally. Nerve conduction studies showed absent sural sensory responses and bilateral peroneal and tibial compound muscle action potentials.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Progressed to very severe axonal sensorimotor polyneuropathy.

relevant_findings.general: Pruritic, violaceous plaques developed in a photodistributed manner on arms, legs, and upper chest.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Eruption evolved from the absence of skin findings to development of pruritic, violaceous plaques.

relevant_findings.general: Weakness in lower extremities, diarrhea, dehydration, rash consistent with prior rash, new leg ulcerations.
relevant_findings.gastrointestinal: Negative stool samples for Clostridium difficile toxin, leukocytes, ova and parasites, and occult blood.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The patient experienced a new episode of weakness and diarrhea with exacerbation of rash and new leg ulcerations.

relevant_findings.general: Limited and painful ambulation, confused during hospital stays.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Confusion persisted. Ambulation limitations gradually worsened due to pain, leading to wheelchair confinement.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Confused during hospital stays. Occasional loose stools.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Continued progression of leg pain, leading to wheelchair confinement.

physical_examinations.date: 13 months later (5 years after initial presentation)

relevant_findings.general: Persistent diarrhea and rash, treated for cellulitis, skin biopsy showed features suggestive of psoriasis and eczema but nondiagnostic.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Photodistributed rash persisted and developed into a bandlike rash around the neck.

relevant_findings.general: Rashes nearly completely resolved, cognition normal, but advanced neuropathy persisted.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Signs of improvement in rashes and cognition but no change in neuropathy status.
